snippet: The proposal, which is scheduled to be presented on Wednesday, was denounced by restaurant representatives as overregulation.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio will present plan to Board of Health that would require large chain restaurants to indicate menu items containing more than 100 percent of recommended daily intake of sodium.
lead_paragraph: The proposal, which is scheduled to be presented on Wednesday, was denounced by restaurant representatives as overregulation.

headline.main: De Blasio Administration Wants High-Sodium Warnings on Menus
headline.print_headline: Mayor Wants Menus to Warn About Sodium
